did.abstract: Jacob (Jack) Rosenbloom (1888-1950) was a member of the International Pocketbook Workers Union. Rosenbloom was born in Warsaw (then part of Imperial Russia) and emigrated to England in approximately 1898. Rosenbloom was a member of the International Pocketbook Workers Union from 1911-1936, eventually becoming Vice Chairman. This collection consists of Rosenbloom's daily diary from 1930. In the entries, Rosenbloom describes his activities inspecting shops in New York as part of his membership in the International Pocketbook Workers Union. He documents the shops he inspected, the number of people working, the conditions of the premises, and complaints regarding working conditions that had been made. The diary is also accompanied by biographical information about Rosenbloom collected by his family.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Jacob (Jack) Rosenbloom (1888-1950) was a member of the International Pocketbook Workers Union. Rosenbloom was born in Warsaw (then part of Imperial Russia) and emigrated to England in approximately 1898. He and his father lived in Manchester, Dublin, and London, before emigrating to New York City in 1907. Rosenbloom was a member of the International Pocketbook Workers Union from 1911-1936, eventually becoming Vice Chairman.
